result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Keshia Marie Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent not in court.  Prosecuting attorney Navjot Singh Hira in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case is set for a Preliminary Hearing. Defense Counsel touched base with the court but did not officially appear. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Keshia Marie Harris appeared by video.  Attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent appeared by video for Keshia Marie Harris.  Prosecuting attorney Abby Rockendorf in court in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case is set for a Status Conference. Defense Counsel informs the court that the defendant would like a Preliminary Hearing. Case is adjourned. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
State Public Defender - Order Appointing Counsel.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Keshia Marie Harris in court, appear in person.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant not eligable for service. Defendant inform court that she contacted SPD due to lost of employment while being in custody. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Status of Counsel in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Status conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Keshia Marie Harris
Current: 8525 W Mill Rd, Apt#2, Milwaukee, WI 53225   (Effective: 07-18-2022)
Prior: 3874 North 24th Place, Milwaukee, WI 53206

Court ordered no contact with JJH,;
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Keshia Marie Harris in court with attorney Michael J Cerniglia.  Defendant Keshia Marie Harris in custody.  Nate Kristian McClure appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Keshia Marie Harris appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38. All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS NOT INDIGENT IF RELEASED. Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 1, a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so.  There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).   
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
